Trade/Device Name(s): Verigene® Enteric Pathogens Nucleic Acid Test (EP)
Regulation Name(s): Gastrointestinal pathogen panel multiplex nucleic acid-based assay system
Analyte(s): Campylobacter Group (C. coli, C. jejuni, C. lari)
Shigella species (S. dysenteriae, S. boydii, S. sonnei, S. flexneri)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Nanosphere Verigene Enteric Pathogens Nucleic Acid Test (EP), a multiplexed qualitative molecular assay for detection and identification of common enteric bacterial pathogens and virulence genes from stool preserved in Cary-Blair media.
Indications for Use Summary: Multiplexed qualitative assay for detection and identification of Campylobacter, Salmonella, Shigella, Vibrio, Yersinia enterocolitica, and Shiga toxin 1/2 genes from liquid or soft stool in Cary-Blair media to aid diagnosis of gastrointestinal infections and outbreaks; not intended for monitoring.
